dismissalText.long: c Taskin Ahmed b Hasan Mahmud
dismissalText.commentary: Curtis Campher c Taskin Ahmed b Hasan Mahmud 36 (48b 4x4 0x6 79m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: Pulled in the air, finds Taskin at deep fine leg! It's the first time Bangladeshi pacers have nine wickets in an ODI innings. Was an 118kph slower one that deceived Campher, he swivelled and went through with the shot. Taskin was in but then went back, reverse-cupped the hands and took it over the head. He was delighted.

headshotImage.longCaption: Ebadot Hossain, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Lorcan Tucker lbw b Ebadot Hossain 28 (31b 4x4 0x6 43m) SR: 90.32

dismissalComment.html: LBW appeal is upheld and Ebadot upper cuts the air in celebration while looking at the batter. Tucker discusses and reviews. Lateral movement off the seam has been reducing in the last few overs, so Ebadot went for the yorker. Tucker's front foot was across on off stump and tried playing the flick. Late swing in the air beat the bat and hit the boot. Hawk-Eye says it's hitting and Tucker has to walk back. Ebadot's manufactured an RKO-esque wicket out of nowhere.

headshotImage.caption: Stephen Doheny, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Stephen Doheny, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalComment.html: Doheny's misery ends, Hasan nicks him off. Test-match dismissal that. Was a length ball just outside off. The batter's feet were stuck and a prod slightly away from the bat led to an outside edge that was taken low by Mushfiqur. Hasan's celebrations are subdued.

headshotImage.caption: PR Stirling headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: PR Stirling headshot

dismissalComment.html: Struck in front, given lbw straight away and Stirling walks, Was around a back of length, pitched at fourth stump and curved back in. Beat the fullish-faced defence and hit him on the knee-roll in front of off stump. Looked dead and Hasan has two in his first spell. Hawk-Eye shows that was hitting three-fourth of the way up middle stump

headshotImage.caption: Harry Tector player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harry Tector player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Inside edge saves Tector. Or has it? Tamim discusses with his team-mates and goes for the review. Back-of-length ball may have kept a bit low. Tector was playing on the back foot as he tried to defend it straight with both feet close together. Ball hit just over the knee roll and the bat was behind. Hawk-Eye shows three reds and the fielders go up in cheers. Hits top of middle, over half the ball was hitting the stumps. Ends up being a brilliant review. Mahmud has 3 for 15, and deserves it.

headshotImage.caption: Curtis Campher player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Curtis Campher player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Pulled in the air, finds Taskin at deep fine leg! It's the first time Bangladeshi pacers have nine wickets in an ODI innings. Was an 118kph slower one that deceived Campher, he swivelled and went through with the shot. Taskin was in but then went back, reverse-cupped the hands and took it over the head. He was delighted.

LBW appeal. Not given, Bangladesh review. Did it hit bat and was it in line, it it didn't. First slow-motion replay shows the in-between length ball came in from outside off, beat the full-faced defence and hit the pad before taking a thin inside edge. Hawk-Eye confirms the impact is in line and it's hitting the stumps. Hasan Mahmud has a five-for

headshotImage.caption: A Balbirnie headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: A Balbirnie headshot

dismissalComment.html: Loose shot considering the circumstances, Taskin's delighted as Shanto at first slip takes the catch. Was a shortish ball just outside off, Balbirnie tried to muscle a back-foot cover drive, stuck to the crease again. Edge went at a comfortable height to Shanto's right. He was standing wider to the keeper. Reached well to pouch it and ran with the momentum to begin celebrations.

headshotImage.caption: AR McBrine headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: AR McBrine headshot

dismissalComment.html: Top edge off the pull balloons to midwicket. Was around a back of length angling in from around the wicket, came in too quickly and McBrine was hurried on the shot. Lobbed right up and Nasum took a sitter. Taskin is pumped.

headshotImage.caption: Mark Adair player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mark Adair player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Beats the Inside edge and hits the stumps Back of length ball comes in at 139.6kph, Adair tried to punch it off the back foot through mid-on but the slight seam movement and the rapid pace of the ball sped through to peg back the off stump and send the bails on a flight.

dismissalText.commentary: George Dockrell b Ebadot Hossain 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Gate breached, off stump knocked over. Ebadot salutes!. Two in two as Ebadot swings another full ball. Dockrell tries to play the line and defend it straight but it zipped through the gate. Came in much quicker than Dockrell expected, his bat curved around from third towards mid-on and there was very little foot movement which cost him. But a heck of a ball to get first up.

commentTextItems.html: Bangladesh win 2-0 but it could very well have been 3-0. Tamim steered the back of length ball outside off to wide third and got the winning run.

commentPostTextItems.html: A one-sided ODI series does carry its drawbacks in terms of competitiveness, but it can shed light on the dominant team's progress which has been the case here. Recap the game in the report and follow the content from Ireland's tour into the T20Is here on ESPNcricinfo. For now, it's goodbye from me, Ekanth, and our scorers, Ranjith P and Binoy George.
The BCB president Nazmul Hasan hands the trophy to Tamim, who goes across to the banner. The players go up in cheers with beaming smiles as they pose for the photographs.

Tamim Iqbal, Bangladesh Captain: Unbelievable. The way we played the whole series was very nice. The performances with the bat in the first two balls, we haven't done before. Now I can proudly say we have a solid, solid, solid fast-bowling department. Players like Miraz, when they start performing with the bat, we can go in with a batter short. We need to keep believing in our players, there will be ups and downs but we have the unit to be the best in the world. The wicket was very good, the way we chased down with authority was a message. Litton played very well. (On the pitches) If you remember, a few weeks ago, I said in a press conference that going forward, we will be playing on high-scoring wickets. Credit to the coach who has helped us develop this new way of playing. When you play on these wickets, you can end up surprising yourself with the results you can achieve.

Mushfiqur Rahim, POTS: Another series win, all the boys chipped in well which was great. The conditions were good in the first two games, the top order did well and set up situations where we could express ourselves. When you're an allrounder, you need to chip in with both bat and gloves, happy to have done it.

Hasan Mahmud, POTM: Grateful for everyone, very excited with the performance. The weather and conditions helped the fast bowlers, enjoyed bowling here. Allan Donald has been the one man who's been behind our improvement, the bowlers have improved gradually as well. We have been working hard on moving the new balls away and hitting our lengths.

Andrew Balbirnie, Ireland Captain: We're very disappointed. Don't think the cricket over the past three days reflects the type of cricket we've played in the last 2-3 years. We did expect spin to play a big part, but our defence with the bat wasn't good enough. We did not adapt well enough. We had a good T20 World cup in Australia, and will have to be a lot better to show up there. Our fielding has been okay, but it's been our batting that has let us down.
redgwan: "@Birdman: in this match Shakib didn't even touch the ball."

Arfaa: "To show the extent of how all-rounded this BD performance has been, I can't think of any clear-cut Player of the Series - there are 4-5 good candidates. In the past, BD victories were dependent on one-man miracle shows. Now, as a BD fan, I am proud to say we finally have a strong team, not just a collection of individuals. "
Sanyat T: "I was heartbroken once by the BD openers against RSA while they were so close to clinch a 10-wicket victory. Finally the heart is fixed."
Zabed: "What a professional play by Bangladesh. Super pace bowling. Amazing Tigers!"
Birdman: "Is this the only Bangladesh win where Shakib didn't have to make any contribution with the bat or the ball - he didn't touch the bat or the ball?" Could very well be

6:17pm: Subdued celebrations and handshakes with the opposition players after through domination from Bangladesh's openers. It's the first time Bangladesh have won by ten wickets. Third-highest win by run rate among all successful chases, Among overs taken to win while chasing, this is the second lowest. It was a clinical performance with the bat by Tamim and Litton, the pace of Hume and Adair was not enough to cause any danger. Humphreys was taken down but he got a bit of exposure at the highest level. But some of the cover drives in this innings will be worth storing in the memory bank. Nothing really from the bowling.

commentTextItems.html: Full at the stumps, Litton is across early and sweeps it along the carpet. Races to the deep-square boundary. Tamim gives him a hug as he brings up fifty

commentTextItems.html: Litton is still as he cuts the shortish ball around fifth this time. Gets it wide of backward point for four
Lobbed up on a length at 79kph. Landed around sixth and spun away. Litton ran across and cut it on the move. Found cover point
Length just down leg, backs away and punches past the left of the bowler. To mid-off
Full on off at 88kph, blocked to the bowler
Full ball is defended to point. Direct hit at the non-striker's end but it won't be sent upstairs.

commentTextItems.html: Charges and goes for a pull. Gets the bouncer off the under edge while turning. Ball fizzles to midwicket
Back of length just outside off, hit on the head to guide it to a catching gully on the bounce
Fullish ball around off at 126kph squares Litton up a bit. Defends with the outer-half of the blade to point
Pitched up and Litton creams a front-foot cover drive. In the gap, races for four.
Beaten after a while. Back-of-length ball is a bit wide. Litton tried to guide it to deep third off the back foot but ended up with a flirty prof
Length on off at 85kph, punched to cover point

commentPostTextItems.html: Rahim Chagani: "Convincing win for Bangladesh but all this talk of World Cup underdogs seems a bit premature for a couple of reasons. 1) All due respect to Ireland, but they're not England, Australia or India" But Bangladesh beat India and ran England close fwiw

commentTextItems.html: Charges but Humphreys holds back his length. Still straight. Blocked in front
Dances down and pumps it towards the sight screen for a big six. Came down to get close to the pitch, was making room while moving which allowed a free swing.
Reverse swept, good stop at short third. Yorker-length ball around off. Tamim did well to change his stance and get it along the ground. Fielder dove to the right to stop it well
Down the pitch, gets to the pitch of the 90kph ball on leg. Flicked to deep midwicket

commentPostTextItems.html: Iftu: "Is the Irish team missing any of their frontline pacers?" Yes, Josh Little and Barry McCarthy are not in

commentPreTextItems.html: Powerplay done, will that change Humphreys' fortunes after a good over from the other end? He'll stay around

dismissalComment.html: Loose shot considering the circumstances, Taskin's delighted as Shanto at first slip takes the catch. Was a shortish ball just outside off, Balbirnie tried to muscle a back-foot cover drive, stuck to the crease again. Edge went at a comfortable height to Shanto's right. He was standing wider to the keeper. Reached well to pouch it and ran with the momentum to begin celebrations.

dismissalText.commentary: Harry Tector lbw b Hasan Mahmud 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Inside edge saves Tector. Or has it? Tamim discusses with his team-mates and goes for the review. Back-of-length ball may have kept a bit low. Tector was playing on the back foot as he tried to defend it straight with both feet close together. Ball hit just over the knee roll and the bat was behind. Hawk-Eye shows three reds and the fielders go up in cheers. Hits top of middle, over half the ball was hitting the stumps. Ends up being a brilliant review. Mahmud has 3 for 15, and deserves it.

dismissalText.commentary: Lorcan Tucker lbw b Ebadot Hossain 28 (31b 4x4 0x6 43m) SR: 90.32

dismissalComment.html: LBW appeal is upheld and Ebadot upper cuts the air in celebration while looking at the batter. Tucker discusses and reviews. Lateral movement off the seam has been reducing in the last few overs, so Ebadot went for the yorker. Tucker's front foot was across on off stump and tried playing the flick. Late swing in the air beat the bat and hit the boot. Hawk-Eye says it's hitting and Tucker has to walk back. Ebadot's manufactured an RKO-esque wicket out of nowhere.

dismissalText.long: c Taskin Ahmed b Hasan Mahmud
dismissalText.commentary: Curtis Campher c Taskin Ahmed b Hasan Mahmud 36 (48b 4x4 0x6 79m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: Pulled in the air, finds Taskin at deep fine leg! It's the first time Bangladeshi pacers have nine wickets in an ODI innings. Was an 118kph slower one that deceived Campher, he swivelled and went through with the shot. Taskin was in but then went back, reverse-cupped the hands and took it over the head. He was delighted.

dismissalText.commentary: George Dockrell b Ebadot Hossain 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Gate breached, off stump knocked over. Ebadot salutes!. Two in two as Ebadot swings another full ball. Dockrell tries to play the line and defend it straight but it zipped through the gate. Came in much quicker than Dockrell expected, his bat curved around from third towards mid-on and there was very little foot movement which cost him. But a heck of a ball to get first up.

dismissalText.commentary: Graham Hume lbw b Hasan Mahmud 3 (19b 0x4 0x6 35m) SR: 15.78

dismissalComment.html: LBW appeal. Not given, Bangladesh review. Did it hit bat and was it in line, it it didn't. First slow-motion replay shows the in-between length ball came in from outside off, beat the full-faced defence and hit the pad before taking a thin inside edge. Hawk-Eye confirms the impact is in line and it's hitting the stumps. Hasan Mahmud has a five-for

dismissalText.long: c Najmul Hossain Shanto b Taskin Ahmed
dismissalText.commentary: Andy Balbirnie c Najmul Hossain Shanto b Taskin Ahmed 6 (18b 1x4 0x6 25m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: Loose shot considering the circumstances, Taskin's delighted as Shanto at first slip takes the catch. Was a shortish ball just outside off, Balbirnie tried to muscle a back-foot cover drive, stuck to the crease again. Edge went at a comfortable height to Shanto's right. He was standing wider to the keeper. Reached well to pouch it and ran with the momentum to begin celebrations.

dismissalText.commentary: Lorcan Tucker lbw b Ebadot Hossain 28 (31b 4x4 0x6 43m) SR: 90.32

dismissalComment.html: LBW appeal is upheld and Ebadot upper cuts the air in celebration while looking at the batter. Tucker discusses and reviews. Lateral movement off the seam has been reducing in the last few overs, so Ebadot went for the yorker. Tucker's front foot was across on off stump and tried playing the flick. Late swing in the air beat the bat and hit the boot. Hawk-Eye says it's hitting and Tucker has to walk back. Ebadot's manufactured an RKO-esque wicket out of nowhere.

dismissalText.commentary: George Dockrell b Ebadot Hossain 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Gate breached, off stump knocked over. Ebadot salutes!. Two in two as Ebadot swings another full ball. Dockrell tries to play the line and defend it straight but it zipped through the gate. Came in much quicker than Dockrell expected, his bat curved around from third towards mid-on and there was very little foot movement which cost him. But a heck of a ball to get first up.

dismissalText.long: c Nasum Ahmed b Taskin Ahmed
dismissalText.commentary: Andy McBrine c Nasum Ahmed b Taskin Ahmed 1 (7b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 14.28

dismissalComment.html: Top edge off the pull balloons to midwicket. Was around a back of length angling in from around the wicket, came in too quickly and McBrine was hurried on the shot. Lobbed right up and Nasum took a sitter. Taskin is pumped.

dismissalText.commentary: Mark Adair b Taskin Ahmed 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Beats the Inside edge and hits the stumps Back of length ball comes in at 139.6kph, Adair tried to punch it off the back foot through mid-on but the slight seam movement and the rapid pace of the ball sped through to peg back the off stump and send the bails on a flight.

dismissalText.long: c Taskin Ahmed b Hasan Mahmud
dismissalText.commentary: Curtis Campher c Taskin Ahmed b Hasan Mahmud 36 (48b 4x4 0x6 79m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: Pulled in the air, finds Taskin at deep fine leg! It's the first time Bangladeshi pacers have nine wickets in an ODI innings. Was an 118kph slower one that deceived Campher, he swivelled and went through with the shot. Taskin was in but then went back, reverse-cupped the hands and took it over the head. He was delighted.

headshotImage.caption: Hasan Mahmud player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Hasan Mahmud player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Graham Hume lbw b Hasan Mahmud 3 (19b 0x4 0x6 35m) SR: 15.78

dismissalComment.html: LBW appeal. Not given, Bangladesh review. Did it hit bat and was it in line, it it didn't. First slow-motion replay shows the in-between length ball came in from outside off, beat the full-faced defence and hit the pad before taking a thin inside edge. Hawk-Eye confirms the impact is in line and it's hitting the stumps. Hasan Mahmud has a five-for
